abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts, achieved through a
            satisfactory Bank performance, and a highly satisfactory
            borrower performance. Findings and implications indicate
            that a) the advantage of broad-based country and political
            ownership of the reform program cannot be underestimated.
            The project provides evidence that the drive towards
            European Union (EU) accession is a powerful impetus for
            reform, and should be capitalized as necessary. Moreover,
            this broad multi-sectoral policy-based operation can be
            useful in signaling the Bank's "endorsement"
            of the overall reform effort; and, in helping the government
            coordinate a wide range of reforms across line ministries.
            Nonetheless, focusing policy-based lending, only on those
            areas/actions the Bank can contribute technically to ensure
            the quality of the various reforms, remains important. To
            this end, the Bank's advice on all areas of the reform
            program, including those that are to be the focus of later
            operations, should be fairly well crafted at the design
            stage of the overall program, and a continuous dialogue
            should be maintained.
